content: place last stitch round 2 knit around worked back onto holding needle place marker start leaf lace and start sk2p 4 read chart from bottom to top and from right to leaf lace leaf lace chart left round 1 *k1 yo k2 ssk p1 k2tog k2 yo* around chart symbols all even rounds knit around round 3 *k2 yo k1 ssk p1 k2tog k1 yo k1* a k around / k2tog round 5 *k3 yo ssk p1 k2tog yo k2* p p around round 7 *k4 yo sk2p yo k3* around √ sk2p rounds 9 & 11 *p1 k2tog k2 yo k1 yo k2 \ ssk ssk* around o yo round 13 *p1 k2tog k1 yo k3 yo k1 ssk* around round 15 *p1 k2tog yo k5 yo ssk* around leaf lace chart round 17 note to start round move marker 1 *see chart note 3 above for start of round 17 stitch to the right remove marker place last end patterning with round 8 stitch worked back onto holding needle place marker and start sk2p *sk2p yo k7 yo* oaa/p\aaoa 19 around oaaaaaaao√ 17* \oaaaaao/p 15 round 19 *k1 yo k2 ssk p1 k2tog k2 yo* \aoaaaoa/p 13 around \aaoaoaa/p 11 work rounds 1 20 3 times total or to desired \aaoaoaa/p 9 length and then work rounds 1 8 aaao√oaaaa 7 aao/p\oaaa 5 start ending aoa/p\aoaa 3 oaa/p\aaoa 1 ending round 1 purl around round 2 cast off loosely purlwise finishing weave in yarn ends and trim after blocking blocking soak cowl in water adding soap appropriate for the fiber if desired rinse and wrap in towel to blot lay flat and smooth into shape pulling out scallops below the decreases at the beginning edge and above the half leafs at the ending edge leave in place until thoroughly dry trim yarn ends www evelynclarkdesigns com estonian leaf lace cowl ©2014 by evelyn a clark page 2
